title: Nutrition and Dietetics
textBlock1: According to Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM), it is through digestion that the energy necessary for the proper functioning of the body is extracted. By adjusting the foods to the individual's condition, we will enhance and improve this energy production, correcting deficiencies, excesses and blockages, improving the execution of the functions of the internal organs.
textBlock2: It is not only used in cases of obesity or anorexia but also in cases where there is a need to re-educate or correct the diet in order to improve the quality of life and consequently the health of the patient.
textBlock3: Each organ has an associated taste and each food has an associated one or more tastes. In addition to the tastes, each food also has an associated nature or temperature, this does not depend on the physical temperature of the food but on the one it causes during and after its digestion. In this way, to restore the balance, foods and cooking methods more appropriate to the condition are selected to enhance the internal regulation mechanism and consequently health.
